translation.en: [in Yiddish] Esty! You can't go out!
High winds broke a wire just down the street.
-Someone will fix it. -[woman 2] Tomorrow. Not on the Sabbath!
translation.ko: - 누군가 고치겠지 - 내일, 안식일엔 못 고쳐

translation.en: I can't go to my mother's for lunch!
translation.ko: 난 점심 먹으러 엄마네도 못 간다니까

translation.en: And I have an excuse to avoid my mother-in-law!
translation.ko: 근데 난 시어머니를 피할 핑계가 생겼지

translation.en: You know, Esty's not trapped like we are! She doesn't have a baby to carry.
translation.ko: 에스티야 갇힐 필요 없지 우리처럼 아기가 없잖아

translation.en: Good point! Just leave your bag upstairs.
translation.ko: 맞는 말이야 가방만 두고 가면 되겠네

translation.en: -Where are you going? -To my parents-in-law. For lunch.
She wasn't sick when I left this morning.
translation.ko: 제가 아침에 나올 때만 해도 괜찮았는데요

translation.en: It's always something with Esty, isn't it?
Go the long way around Williamsburg, please.
[in Yiddish] Yanky, shouldn't you be at the synagogue?
She wasn't home after lunch yesterday
and she never came home last night.

translation.ko: - 어딜 갔는데? - 그걸 모르니 하는 말이죠!

translation.en: Has she been in an accident?
That girl was never good enough for you!
-[man 4] Mimi! -[Mimi] She was trouble from the start.
A year of marriage and not even a baby!
translation.ko: 결혼한 지 1년 됐는데 아기도 못 낳고!

translation.en: We shouldn't have agreed to the match.
[Esty's grandma] My father loved this song.
He had a wonderful voice, Esty.
All the men in his family did.
But soon you'll have children of your own.
translation.ko: 너도 곧 네 자식을 갖게 될 게다

translation.en: -Grandpa will be home any minute. -[Esty] He's not here yet!
translation.ko: - 할아버지 금방 오실 텐데 - 아직 안 오셨잖아요

translation.en: So he'll hear women singing when he arrives? No.
translation.ko: 여자 노랫소리 들으시면 어쩌려고? 안 되지

translation.en: [in Yiddish] The matchmaker made a suggestion.
The Shapiros near the Navy Yard.
translation.ko: 해군 공창 근처 사는 샤피로 집안요
- 보석 사업 하는? - 네, 형제들이 하죠

translation.en: But the father has never worked.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 아버지는 한 번도 일한 적 없대요

translation.en: -He sits and studies! -[Esty's grandma in English] That's good!
-[in Yiddish] What's the boy like? -What's the boy like?
Your marriage will mark the beginning of a new life!
[Malka in English] Hold on a minute.
[in Yiddish] Let's wait till the Shapiros agree to the match, alright?
After all, Esty is an orphan.
You're not staying for the meal?
[in Yiddish] Tell us everything about your wife, Yanky.
translation.ko: 네 아내에 대해 다 말해봐라, 얀키

translation.en: I'm in Manhattan during the day.
I work with my brothers in the business now.
Esty does what all the other wives do.
translation.ko: 에스티는 다른 아내들과 다를 거 없었어요

translation.en: She shops, she cooks, she visits her grandmother...
Esty isn't like the other wives.
Yanky, come on! She doesn't even visit with them.
translation.ko: 얀키, 정신 차려 동서들과 어울리지도 않잖아

translation.en: You have no idea how Esty spends the day.
translation.ko: 에스티가 낮에 뭘 하는지 전혀 모르잖아

translation.en: Gentlemen. The point is, we can't have our people losing their way.
translation.ko: 요점은 우리 사람이 길을 잃게 둘 수 없단 겁니다

translation.en: We need to find this young woman and bring her back to her husband!
translation.ko: 이 젊은 여인을 찾아 남편에게 돌려줘야 합니다

translation.en: -I've asked your cousin Moishe to help. -Moishe?
translation.ko: - 너희 사촌 모이셰가 도와줄 거다 - 모이셰요?
- 내가 죽기 전엔 안 돼요! - 미미

translation.en: The rabbi understands that Moishe has his own problems, right?
translation.ko: 랍비께서도 모이셰가 나름의 문제가 있는 건 아셔

translation.en: Not to mention, in his marriage.
"A Jew, though he sinned, is still a Jew."
Moishe is the one to find your son's wife.
How far can she possibly have gone?
Miriam Shapiro wants to see you.
translation.ko: 미리암 샤피로가 널 보고 싶어 해

translation.en: How will I know which one she is?
Now walk as if you're looking for something. With a smile.
translation.ko: 찾는 물건이 있는 척해 얼굴에 미소 띠고

translation.en: [barista] Would you like to see a menu?
You have a lot of friends.
Yeah. A lot of tired friends.
-[barista] That will be two euros, twenty. -Yes.
-[in English] Here we are. Coffee! -[man 7] Oh, nice!
translation.ko: - 다 왔어요, 커피 왔어! - 와, 좋다

translation.en: -They're all the same. -[woman 7] Thanks. You're so sweet.
translation.ko: - 다 똑같은 거야 - 고마워, 넌 참 착해

translation.en: -[in German] We'll start in a minute. -OK, I'm coming.
[in English] We have to bring these inside,
because we have a rehearsal now.
-See you around. -[woman 8] See you around, Esty.
I'm assuming you all stayed in last night and practiced your parts?
translation.ko: 모두 지난밤에 남아서 각자 파트를 연습했겠지?

translation.en: Can anyone think of a better way to spend a Saturday evening in Berlin?
translation.ko: 베를린의 토요일 저녁을 그보다 잘 보낼 방법이 있을까?

translation.en: Let's start from the trio of the second movement.
Peace be upon you! How do you do?
Don't forget, Esty. He speaks first.
translation.ko: 잊지 마, 에스티 남자가 먼저 말하는 거야

translation.en: My father took me and my brothers to Europe last spring.
translation.ko: 아버지께서 지난봄 형제들과 절 유럽에 데려가셨죠

translation.en: We visited the graves of all the famous rabbis.
translation.ko: 유명한 옛 랍비들 무덤은 전부 가봤어요

translation.en: You went all the way to Europe and all you saw were graves?
translation.ko: 그 멀리 유럽까지 가서 무덤만 봤어요?

translation.en: but my father didn't allow it.
I want to go back someday.
They say London and Paris are beautiful.
I've never been anywhere but New York.
translation.ko: 전 뉴욕을 벗어나 본 적 없어요

translation.en: My brothers and I sometimes perform together with my father.
translation.ko: 형제들, 아버지와 함께 연주를 하곤 해요

translation.en: I mean, do you like music?
I bet you sound beautiful when you play together.
I hope to see it one day.
I'm not like the other girls.
I'm different from the other girls.
[in English] I'll get the car, guys.
It was the most beautiful thing I have ever heard.
-[man 8] I'm ready. -Let's go! Come on. Dasia!
I have to practice. What the hell am I supposed to do?
[in Yiddish] You spoke to her mother?
You know she doesn't have a mother. Just a grandmother and an aunt.
translation.ko: 어머니 없는 거 알잖아 할머니랑 고모뿐이야

translation.en: My cousin, Moishe Lefkovitch. You remember him.
translation.ko: 제 사촌 모이셰 레프코비츠예요 기억하실 텐데요

translation.en: We're here to ask you and your mother that question exactly.
translation.ko: 고모님과 할머님께 같은 질문을 하러 왔습니다

translation.en: Now it's my job to keep track of your wife?
translation.ko: 내가 자네 부인 꽁무니나 쫓아다니는 사람인가?

translation.en: She hasn't been home since yesterday.
[Malka] Nobody can find out about this.
-Can we ask your mother a few questions? -[Malka] No!
You want to scare an old woman?
Her life hasn't been difficult enough?
It's as she left it when she moved out to get married.
[woman 9 in English] Yeah, I'm teaching a class!
I am Mordecai Schwartz. This is my daughter.
We're here to collect the rent.
I have a tour coming up in two weeks, OK? It's two weeks in the Midwest.
I'll get paid right after. And then I can pay you the back rent.
translation.ko: 끝나면 바로 돈 받아요 그럼 밀린 월세 드릴게요

translation.en: And then I'll pay you three months in advance, OK?
Yeah, I'm good for it. I just need two weeks.
translation.ko: 네, 낼 수 있어요 2주만 시간을 주세요

translation.en: [in English] George? I'll just be one more minute, OK?
-[Mordecai in Yiddish] So what? What? -[in English] Do you play?
Anyway, we don't have one at home.
[in Yiddish] Why did you send me? Go yourself!
translation.ko: 그럼 절 왜 보냈어요? 직접 하세요!

translation.en: -[in English] You're welcome to play here. -[Mordecai in Yiddish] I don't know!
[in English] If you want, I could teach you.
[man 8] Is this your first time in Berlin, Esty?
[in German] Let's show her something nice.
-[in English] Let's go! -Like what? Hitler's bunker?
-It's still there? -No, she's just messing with you.
translation.ko: - 아직도 있어? - 아냐, 너 놀리는 거야

translation.en: Or we can take selfies at the memorial to the murdered Jews of Europe.
translation.ko: 유대인 학살 추모공원에서 셀카를 찍어도 되고

translation.en: That, Yael, is a superb idea.
And the memorial to the murdered homosexuals is just across the street.
there's one to the murdered Sinti and Romas nearby, too.
-[woman 7] You don't sound like it. -I've never been anywhere else.
translation.ko: - 뉴요커 발음이 아닌데 - 다른 덴 가본 적 없어

translation.en: Yemen. But I grew up near Munich.
And I'm from Israel, Ahmed is from Nigeria,
Clemens... is German, but your parents came from...?
And Robert is the only one of us who is actually from Berlin.
So he can answer all your burning questions about the war.
translation.ko: 그러니 전쟁에 관한 핵심을 찌르는 질문은 쟤가 답할 수 있지

translation.en: My grandparents lost their whole families in the camps.
translation.ko: 우리 조부모님은 수용소에서 가족을 전부 잃으셨어

translation.en: But we're too busy defending our present to be sentimental about our past.
translation.ko: 근데 감상적으로 과거를 대하기엔 현재를 방어하기 바빠서 말이지

translation.en: -Yael always talks big, big, big-- -A lot of talking.
translation.ko: - 야엘은 늘 말이 거창해 - 말이 참 많지

translation.en: [Robert] Yeah, a lot of talking. But she's never been in military combat.
translation.ko: 어, 말만 많고 전투에 나선 적은 없어

translation.en: She was playing the violin in the military orchestra.
Like Vivaldi's "Four Seasons" every weekend, madam?
Well, at least you have a life. [giggles]
The conference where the Nazis decided to kill the Jews in the concentration camps
translation.ko: 나치가 유대인을 강제수용소에서 죽이자고 결정한 회의가

translation.en: And you swim in this lake?
Well, the lake is just a lake.
When the Berlin Wall was up,
East German guards shot anyone who tried to swim across this lake to freedom.
translation.ko: 자유를 찾아 헤엄쳐 넘어오던 사람들을 동독 경비대가 쏴 죽였어

translation.en: Now you can swim as far as you like.
You go in. I'll watch everyone's stuff.
translation.ko: 들어가 봐 애들 짐은 내가 볼게

translation.en: You can't just come into my apartment like this!
translation.ko: 내 집에 이렇게 마구 들어오시면 안 되죠!

translation.en: I've been paying my rent on time!
You know exactly who I'm talking about.
-Moishe! -Jesus! What is wrong with you people?
She quit the piano lessons for you.
Tell me where to find her.
-I don't know. -[Moishe] Alright, Ms. Vivian Dropkin.
If you don't tell us where she is, we'll cut off your electricity.
translation.ko: 어디 있는지 말 안 하면 전기를 끊을 거요

translation.en: [in Yiddish] Maybe she doesn't know anything.
[in English] We'll cut off your internet.
And then we'll cancel your lease.
-[Dasia] Ahmed doesn't know any German. -[Esty] Really?
Yeah, but he thinks he can fake speaking German with just three words.
translation.ko: 응, 근데 딱 세 단어로 할 줄 아는 척 속일 수 있대

translation.en: We have the same words in Yiddish:
I will try that, if I ever go to a dinner party.
So you're really going back to practice now? What, so late?
translation.ko: 정말로 연습하러 돌아갈 거야? 이렇게 늦은 시간에?

translation.en: The academy is open till midnight.
-I hope to see you around, Esty. -Yeah.
Yanky, one thing leads to another.
You let her take piano lessons with that shiksa, right?
translation.ko: 그 이교도 피아노 선생한테 수업받게 해줬지?

translation.en: Schlomo Moskowitz takes his wife out to bars in Manhattan!
translation.ko: 슐로모 모스코비츠는 아내를 맨해튼 술집에 데려가!

translation.en: I mean, even your clothes? Your phone?
Esty took nothing because it was the Sabbath and the eruv was broken.
translation.ko: 에스티가 맨몸으로 간 건 안식일에 에루브가 깨져서야

translation.en: Did you already check her phone for funny numbers?

translation.ko: 확인 안 한 음성 메시지가 있네

translation.en: The doctor's office called about blood test results
and offered an appointment for an ultrasound next week.
translation.ko: 다음 주에 초음파 검사 예약 잡자는 전화야

translation.en: -[guard in German] Good evening! -[Dasia] Good evening!
And she didn't even take anything with her!
-That depends how you look at it. -She took the baby!
translation.ko: - 그건 어떻게 보느냐에 따라 달라 - 아기를 품고 갔죠!

translation.en: Her crazy mother lives in Berlin!
I thought she came from England?
She came from Manchester to Williamsburg,
but when she left Yanky's father-in-law, she moved to Germany.
We shouldn't have agreed to this marriage.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin?
[rabbi] Life is a never-ending battle between good and evil.
translation.ko: 인생은 선과 악 사이의 끊임없는 전투야
하느님께서는 언제나 우리를 시험에 들게 하시지

translation.en: Anyway, the boy can't handle a trip to Berlin on his own.
translation.ko: 어쨌든, 저 애 혼자 베를린 여행 감당 못 할 거야

translation.en: The rabbi wants me to go to Berlin with Yanky?
translation.ko: 랍비께서는 제가 얀키를 데리고 가길 바라시나요?

translation.en: Of course he's going with you, Moishe!
I will wait in the kitchen.
[in English] You stopped being my mother the day you left Williamsburg.
[in Yiddish] No. I will always be your mother.
[in English] No matter where I go.
I wanted to give you this.
Proves your right to German citizenship.
translation.ko: 네가 독일 국민 자격이 있다는 증서지

translation.en: Because my parents, your grandparents, were born there.
translation.ko: 내 부모님, 조부모님이 모두 거기서 태어나셨으니까

translation.en: It's just in case you need somewhere else to go.
translation.ko: 어딘가 갈 곳이 필요할 때를 대비해서 갖고 있어

translation.en: I'm getting married. Don't you get it?
I'm going to make a family with Yanky Shapiro.
Lots of children. A real home.
I won't ever need anywhere else to go. This is what I want.
translation.ko: 어딘가 갈 일 없어요 이게 내가 원하는 거예요

translation.en: -OK, you think that now-- -Don't you tell me what I think.
translation.ko: - 그래, 지금 생각엔... - 내 생각을 알기나 해요?

translation.en: -You don't even know me. -[Esty's mom] Maybe not.
But you keep those documents safe, please.
Rabbi, I don't know if I'm the right--
Bring back Esther Shapiro and God will take care of you.
translation.ko: 에스터 샤피로를 데려오게 하느님께서 자넬 돌봐주실 거야

translation.en: Work things out with your wife and children.
The rabbi will do all that for me?
